title: 21 Inspiring Quotes on the Power of Taking a Vacation
description: Taking a break from the grind of work isn’t just a treat, but also an investment in maintaining long-term health and happiness.
author: Peter Economy
excerpt: Taking time off is one of the best ways to increase creativity, make better decisions, and improve focus. Here are 21 quotes about vacation.
text: I’m sure you know that taking a vacation is a good thing. So, you might be surprised to learn that while American workers receive approximately 12 days off each year, fewer than half of those workers—47 percent—plan to take all 12 days off. That’s, unfortunately, a lot of vacation time not being taken. “Taking time off is one of the best ways to become more creative, make better decisions and increase your focus,” says psychologist Susan Albers. Not only that, but taking a vacation can also be an adventure and an awful lot of fun (ask me about my trip to Iceland last year for a friend’s wedding). Quotes to inspire you to take a vacation and recharge1. “A vacation is having nothing to do and all day to do it in.” –Bob Orben, comedy writer and magician 2. “To travel is to live.” –Hans Christian Andersen, author 3. “Jobs fill your pocket, but adventures fill your soul.” –Jamie Lyn Beatty, actress and singer 4. “Oh, the places you’ll go!” –Dr. Seuss, author 5. “Almost everything will work again if you unplug it for a few minutes, including you.” –Anne Lamott, novelist 6. “A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.” –Lao Tzu, philosopher 7. “Life’s short. Eat dessert first, work less and vacation more.” –Lea Mishell, author 8. “Travel and change of place impart new vigor to the mind.” –Seneca, philosopher 9. “The world is a book, and those who do not travel read only one page.” –Saint Augustine, theologian 10. “Sometimes the most productive thing you can do is relax.” –Mark Black, author 11. “Travel brings power and love back into your life.” –Rumi, poet 12. “A change of latitude would help my attitude.” –Unknown 13. “In matters of healing the body or the mind, vacation is a true genius.” –Mehmet Murat Ildan, playwright 14. “Each person deserves a day away in which no problems are confronted, no solutions searched for.” – Maya Angelou, poet 15. “The purpose of a vacation is to have the time to rest. But many of us, even when we go on vacation, don’t know how to rest.” –Thich Nhat Hanh, Buddhist monk 16. “The vacation we often need is freedom from our own mind.” –Jack Adam Weber, author 17. “Travel is the only thing you buy that makes you richer.” –Unknown 18. “Taking time to do nothing often brings everything into perspective.” –Doe Zantamata, author 19. “A mind that is stretched by a new experience can never go back to its old dimensions.” –Oliver Wendell Holmes, jurist 20. “If we were meant to stay in one place, we’d have roots instead of feet.” –Rachel Wolchin, author 21. “Live your life by a compass, not a clock.” –Erica Jong, author As these quotes so richly demonstrate, taking a break from the grind of work is not just a treat but an essential investment in maintaining your long-term health and happiness. So, start the ball rolling by planning your next trip. It’s an opportunity for you to take some time to rest, recuperate, and embrace the healing benefits of a vacation you so well deserve. The opinions expressed here by Inc.com columnists are their own, not those of Inc.com.The early-rate deadline for the 2025 Inc. html:
I’m sure you know that taking a vacation is a good thing. So, you might be surprised to learn that while American workers receive approximately 12 days off each year, fewer than half of those workers—47 percent—plan to take all 12 days off. That’s, unfortunately, a lot of vacation time not being taken. 

“Taking time off is one of the best ways to become more creative, make better decisions and increase your focus,” says psychologist Susan Albers. Not only that, but taking a vacation can also be an adventure and an awful lot of fun (ask me about my trip to Iceland last year for a friend’s wedding). 

Quotes to inspire you to take a vacation and recharge

1. “A vacation is having nothing to do and all day to do it in.” –Bob Orben, comedy writer and magician 

2. “To travel is to live.” –Hans Christian Andersen, author 

3. “Jobs fill your pocket, but adventures fill your soul.” –Jamie Lyn Beatty, actress and singer 

4. “Oh, the places you’ll go!” –Dr. Seuss, author 

5. “Almost everything will work again if you unplug it for a few minutes, including you.” –Anne Lamott, novelist 

6. “A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.” –Lao Tzu, philosopher 

7. “Life’s short. Eat dessert first, work less and vacation more.” –Lea Mishell, author 

8. “Travel and change of place impart new vigor to the mind.” –Seneca, philosopher 

9. “The world is a book, and those who do not travel read only one page.” –Saint Augustine, theologian 

10. “Sometimes the most productive thing you can do is relax.” –Mark Black, author 

11. “Travel brings power and love back into your life.” –Rumi, poet 

12. “A change of latitude would help my attitude.” –Unknown 

13. “In matters of healing the body or the mind, vacation is a true genius.” –Mehmet Murat Ildan, playwright 

14. “Each person deserves a day away in which no problems are confronted, no solutions searched for.” – Maya Angelou, poet 

15. “The purpose of a vacation is to have the time to rest. But many of us, even when we go on vacation, don’t know how to rest.” –Thich Nhat Hanh, Buddhist monk 

16. “The vacation we often need is freedom from our own mind.” –Jack Adam Weber, author 

17. “Travel is the only thing you buy that makes you richer.” –Unknown 

18. “Taking time to do nothing often brings everything into perspective.” –Doe Zantamata, author 

19. “A mind that is stretched by a new experience can never go back to its old dimensions.” –Oliver Wendell Holmes, jurist 

20. “If we were meant to stay in one place, we’d have roots instead of feet.” –Rachel Wolchin, author 

21. “Live your life by a compass, not a clock.” –Erica Jong, author 

As these quotes so richly demonstrate, taking a break from the grind of work is not just a treat but an essential investment in maintaining your long-term health and happiness. So, start the ball rolling by planning your next trip. It’s an opportunity for you to take some time to rest, recuperate, and embrace the healing benefits of a vacation you so well deserve. 

The opinions expressed here by Inc.com columnists are their own, not those of Inc.com.
